title: Accepting my mom’s drinking problem was a long journey. Here’s what it took.
text: She’s the kind of mom who answered the phone through the night if you needed her. She would stay on the phone to talk about nothing if you wanted to. She’s the kind of mom who’d stock the fridge with homemade lasagna, cakes and chocolate almond milk before I came for a visit. She’s the mom who’d tell you how perfect you are and that the only thing you need to do is believe in yourself. She’s the mom who got genuinely upset when others hurt us. Her default was always to have our backs, even when we didn’t really deserve it. She never found fault in us, even when it would have been easy to.
description: She was my angel and my antagonist
